title: 'Les Misérables' musical captured hearts across the world, but not in France
summary: For 40 years, the musical based on Victor Hugo's masterpiece has enjoyed unrivaled success worldwide. Since being given a West End twist, however, it has been a flop in France. Now, a French team has created a new version of the show that they hope will be more palatable to French audiences, on stage at the Théâtre du Châtelet, Paris, from November 20.

title: Russia and Ukraine launch biggest drone attacks of conflict
summary: US President-elect Trump, who says he will be talking directly to Russian President Putin, has the potential to upend the almost three-year conflict, but will not be inaugurated until January and for the moment, the conflict shows no signs of subsiding.

title: Dozens killed in Gaza and Lebanon as Israel faces aid deadline given by US
summary: The mid-month deadline is approaching for the Biden administration's ultimatum for Israel: Allow more aid into Gaza or risk possible restrictions on US military funding.

title: Mexico says over 250 migrants found in US-bound truck
summary: Donald Trump's recent election victory has fueled concerns among migrants that it will become harder to win asylum after he becomes president.

title: COP29: An unprecedented crisis between France and Azerbaijan
summary: Sickened by Paris' diplomatic and military support for its Armenian rival, Baku retaliated by arresting three French nationals and launching an anti-French media campaign in its overseas territories.

title: Five peace gardens in France at sites of the Great War
summary: On the eve of commemorating the Armistice of November 11, 1918, 'The Morning List' takes you on a journey to explore locations ideal for contemplation and reflection.

title: 'Derrida's reception in France suffers from a simplistic use of the terms deconstruction'
summary: Benoît Peeters, the philosopher's biographer, reacts to the re-publication of 'Specters of Marx' and considers the posterity of the philosopher's writings.

title: A feminist man's guidebook to sex
summary: As masculinism and violence are resurging, Le Monde's sex columnist, Maïa Mazaurette, offers some advice on how to rediscover a peaceful, caring sexuality.

title: Haiti governing council moves to replace PM in power struggle
summary: The nine-member council's decision seeks to push out Prime Minister Garry Conille after just five months in office and replace him with businessman Alix Didier Fils-Aime. The council is a new body that is not mentioned in the constitution and it was not approved by parliament because Haiti now does not have a sitting legislature.

title: Macron to attend France-Israel football match on Thursday
summary: Along with the French president, around 4,000 police will be present at the game at the Stade de France after an outbreak of violence in Amsterdam last week.

title: In Sweden, the prime minister's wife's clerical dress causes controversy
summary: Ulf Kristersson's wife, Birgitta Ed, was ordained a priest in January 2023. Since then, she's worn her clerical collar consistently, sparking heated debate in Sweden.

title: Thousands protest in Valencia as distrust in Spanish government grows over flood response
summary: Over 100,000 people protested the regional authority's response to the deadly floods in Valencia on Saturday, after it was revealed they failed to respond to the scale of the tragedy on time.

title: 2024 US Election: Donald Trump wins Arizona in swing state sweep
summary: Trump, who was declared the 47th President of the United States on Wednesday, picked up another 11 electoral votes, giving him a total of 312 to Harris' 226.

title: Far-right fake jobs trial: Marine Le Pen could automatically be banned from running for president in 2027
summary: The far-right leader is being prosecuted for misappropriation of European Parliament funds from 2011 to 2016. If she were to be convicted, a 2016 law imposes a mandatory sentence of ineligibility to run for five years.

title: Western embarrassment at North Korean involvement in the war in Ukraine
summary: On Friday, NATO confirmed the deployment of soldiers sent by Pyongyang alongside Russian forces near Kursk.

title: Netanyahu says he 'greenlighted' Lebanon pager attacks
summary: Israeli Prime Minister's spokesperson told Agence France-Presse he 'greenlighted the pager operation' in Lebanon in September, which killed almost 40 people.

title: Ancient DNA reveals the origins of Pompeii's inhabitants
summary: International researchers analyzed the genetic material of casts on victims of the Vesuvius eruption. Their kinship and gender do not match the stories told until now.

title: Qatar suspends Gaza mediation until Israel and Hamas show 'seriousness,' says foreign ministry
summary: On the ground in the besieged Gaza Strip, the fighting showed no signs of abating on Saturday, the war's 400th day.

title: COP29: Financial aid for developing countries at heart of tense discussions
summary: States are due to adopt a new global climate financing target to replace the $100 billion pledged in 2009. But they can't agree on any of the sensitive issues, be it the amount, the contributors or the beneficiaries.

title: COP29: Azerbaijan wants to improve its image without giving up oil
summary: Nearly 30 dissidents, journalists and trade unionists have been arrested in recent months ahead of COP29, while the country sees the summit as an opportunity to improve its reputation on the international stage.

title: Trump demands Senate bypass votes to confirm appointees
summary: Under the US Constitution, the Senate must vote to approve nominations made by the president for senior executive positions, such as cabinet posts and judicial appointments. A constitutional clause, however, allows for presidents to bypass a Senate vote if the chamber is in an extended recess.

title: Lessons from the first Jewish immigrants to Palestine
summary: The leaders of the first wave of Jewish immigration to Palestine at the end of the 19th century were already in no doubt about the inevitability of conflict with the land's Arab population.

title: EU ambivalence towards Georgia's disputed parliamentary elections
summary: The EU is calling for an independent investigation into irregularities in the voting process  on October 26. However, it does not intend to take a position on the election's legitimacy, much to the disappointment of the opposition, which is pro-European. The pro-Russian ruling party has been in power since 2012.

title: COP29 opens in a more perilous context than ever for the climate
summary: Donald Trump's election comes as geopolitical tensions run high and the US faces a sluggish economy. The challenge at this year's COP will be to reach an agreement on financing to keep climate negotiations on track.

title: 2024 will be hottest year on record and exceed 1.5°C warming for first time
summary: In its provisional report on the state of the climate in 2024, published on Monday, November 11, the World Meteorological Organization said global average temperatures will be 1.54°C warmer than the preindustrial era. It issued 'the maximum alert in the face of the unbridled pace of climate change.'

title: Trump says former ICE director Tom Homan will be appointed 'border czar'
summary: Tom Homan, the former acting director of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement under Donald Trump's first presidency, will be tasked with overseeing the mass deportations that were a core campaign promise.

title: Pope's planned visit to Corsica sparks tension
summary: Francis is expected on the French island around December 14-15. However, he has declined an invitation to Paris to attend the reopening of Notre-Dame a week before, which has irritated the French presidency.

title: Kremlin denies reported Trump-Putin call about Ukraine
summary: Following a The Washington Post report that claimed that President-elect Donald Trump had spoken about the war in Ukraine with Vladimir Putin, notably pushing against escalation and planning discussions on its 'resolution,' the Kremlin issued a denial.

title: What happens to Donald Trump's legal cases now?
summary: Seriously implicated in four separate criminal cases, Trump will now likely be able to avoid the trials that would have awaited him if he had lost the election.

title: In northern Israel, Kiryat Shmona's displaced lose hope of return
summary: For over a year, almost all the 25,000 inhabitants of the town on the border with Lebanon have fled the region. The families, scattered throughout Israeli territory, are housed in hotels, with no clear vision of their future.

title: COP29: 'Supporting the fight against climate change in the global South is not one of the North's priorities'
summary: Romain Weikmans, an international relations professor, explains the obstacles to financial transfers between global North and South countries to fund the green transition, a core issue of the Baku climate conference.

title: In France's military cemeteries, soldiers of the British Empire and the guardians of their memory
summary: The Commonwealth War Graves Commission honors the memory of fallen members of the former British Empire around the world. In France, 400 of the institution's employees watch over the resting places of the 575,000 people killed on French soil.

title: Agricultural problems persist in Europe as farmers plan protests
summary: Like in France, farmers' organizations in Belgium and Poland are denouncing the free trade agreement negotiated between the European Union and the MERCOSUR countries. Action is being planned.

title: Typhoon Toraji hit the Philippines on Monday, fourth storm in a month
summary: Here's a photo review of the four typhoons that hit the Southeast Asian country, killing nearly 160 people and devastating the northern region of the archipelago.

title: 'Sexual violence can be explained not only by a lack of education, but also by a lack of interest and activism by men'
summary: Men's growing awareness of sexual violence against women owes a great deal to feminist raising awareness work, which is not given the recognition it deserves, writes researcher Florian Vörös.

title: Italian judges deal new blow to Albania migrant scheme
summary: The ruling challenges Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's plan to process migrants outside the EU, highlighting conflicts between Italian and European immigration laws.

title: War in Sudan: Death strikes at every corner  in devastated Khartoum
summary: 'In Sudan, a total war' (1/8). Since April 15, 2023, the conflict between General al-Burhan's forces and General Hemedti's militias may have claimed the lives of over 150,000 civilians. Le Monde reports from the army-controlled areas of Sudan in the first part of a series on a country where the hopes of the 2019 revolution have been shattered by war, now fueling the world's worst humanitarian crisis.

title: COP29: Nations approve new standards on carbon markets
summary: Nearly 200 nations agreed on a number of crucial ground rules for a credible, UN-backed international carbon market, enabling countries to trade high-quality carbon credits to help meet climate targets.

title: Israeli minister reports some progress toward cease-fire but Hezbollah unaware
summary: Israeli Foreign Minister Gideon Saar said any agreement would have to include enforcement mechanisms to prevent Hezbollah from reconstituting its military infrastructure near the border.

title: Spirit Airlines says flight to Haiti's capital hit by gunfire
summary: Flight 951 from Fort Lauderdale, Florida to Port-au-Prince was diverted and landed safely in neighboring Dominican Republic, Spirit said in a statement. The Haitian capital is largely controlled by powerful, well-armed gangs.

title: New Haiti PM sworn in, promises to 'restore security'
summary: The Caribbean nation has long struggled with political instability, poverty, natural disasters and gang violence. But conditions sharply worsened at the end of February when armed groups launched coordinated attacks in the capital Port-au-Prince, saying they wanted to overthrow then-prime minister Ariel Henry.
